vision.notes: Vision is present, likely used for navigation and social interaction. Body has a paler underside to appear less conspicuous from below (countershading).

hearing.notes: Hearing is well-developed for underwater communication and navigation. Fin whales communicate utilizing frequency-modulated sounds.

touch.notes: Likely important for social interactions and sensing the environment.

taste/chemoreception.notes: The presence and role of taste or chemoreception are unknown but likely used for food discrimination.

smell/olfaction.notes: The presence and role of smell is unknown. It is difficult to study.

echolocation.notes: Echolocation abilities are not mentioned in the provided texts, though hearing is well-developed, it is unknown if this family uses echolocation.
